application_credentials.description:
Follow the [instructions]({more_info_url}) for [OAuth consent screen]({oauth_consent_url}) to give Home Assistant access to your Google Calendar. You also need to create Application Credentials linked to your Calendar:
1. Go to [Credentials]({oauth_creds_url}) and click **Create Credentials**.
1. From the drop-down list select **OAuth client ID**.
1. Select **TV and Limited Input devices** for the Application Type.

abort.already_in_progress: Configuration flow is already in progress
abort.code_expired: Authentication code expired or credential setup is invalid, please try again.
abort.missing_configuration: The component is not configured. Please follow the documentation.

progress.exchange:
To link your Google account, visit the [{url}]({url}) and enter code:

{user_code}

reauth_confirm.description: The Google Calendar integration needs to re-authenticate your account
reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate Integration

deprecated_yaml.description:
Configuring the Google Calendar in configuration.yaml is being removed in Home Assistant 2022.9.

Your existing OAuth Application Credentials and access settings have been imported into the UI automatically. Remove the YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
deprecated_yaml.title: The Google Calendar YAML configuration is being removed

removed_track_new_yaml.description: You have disabled entity tracking for Google Calendar in configuration.yaml, which is no longer supported. You must manually change the integration System Options in the UI to disable newly discovered entities going forward. Remove the track_new setting from configuration.yaml and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
removed_track_new_yaml.title: Google Calendar entity tracking has changed

data.calendar_access: Home Assistant access to Google Calendar
